intro: [WRONG START] Gelonia humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's gelonium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from yellow to orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
